negotiation_message: Alice said in round 1: Hi Lingyao, I'm looking forward to negotiating with you on dividing up these items. Since there are 5 items total, what do you think about me getting 3 items and you getting 2 items? That seems like a fair starting point, and we can discuss which specific items to take from there to make sure the final deal is pareto optimal and envy-free for both of us. Let me know what you think!
Lingyao replied in round 1: I can take your suggestion, but can you let me pick the two items? I hope get 1 ball and 1 hat.

Alice said in round 2: I appreciate your willingness to consider an uneven split of 3 items for me and 2 for you as a starting point. However, the 1 ball is very important to me. What if I take the 1 ball and 1 book, and you can have the other 3 items (the other book, and the 2 hats)? That way, we each get the categories of items most valuable to us, which should help ensure the deal is pareto optimal and envy-free. Let me know if you would be open to that.

Lingyao replied in round 2: I already give you 3 items. I can be honest with you that the ball is the most valuable item for me. I can let you have all the other items. In other words, I will take 1 ball, while you will take 2 books and 2 hats.

Alice said in round 3: 
I hear you that the ball is very valuable to you. It's also quite important to me. Since we both highly value the ball, what if we look for a compromise that doesn't involve either of us getting it? 

Here's a proposal: You take the 2 hats and 1 of the books (3 items total). I'll take just the other book (1 item total). That way, neither of us gets the contested ball, but the rest of the items are split in a way that hopefully gives us each some of what we want. 

I'm willing to take fewer items overall in order to find an agreement. Let me know what you think - I'm open to discussing further to find a deal we're both satisfied with.

Lingyao replied in round 3: But that would give us a pareto solution, right? I can let you take all the hats and books, while I take teve the highest score in total. If I may ask, how many points does a ball mean for you?

Alice said in round 4: 
I appreciate you being open to finding a pareto optimal solution. While I'd prefer not to share the exact point values, I can say that the ball is worth significantly more points to me than the hats and books combined.

Since we both highly value the ball, what if we split it? I take the ball and you take all 4 of the other items (2 hats and 2 books). That way, we each get some of what we want most.

I believe this would be both pareto optimal, since any other division would make one of us worse off, and envy-free, since we each get the item(s) most valuable to us personally. Let me know if you would agree to this plan.

Lingyao replied in round 4: Let me be honest with you. Neither the book nor the hat has a value for me. Only the ball has value for me. I think you take the hats and books while I take the ball can give us the highest scores in total.

Alice said in round 5: 
Thank you for your honesty, I really appreciate it. Since the hats and books have no value to you, and the ball is the only item you care about, I understand why you want the ball.

Given the ball is so important to both of us, I wonder if we could find a creative solution. What if:

I take all 4 of the hats and books (which have some value to me but none to you). 
You take the ball.
And to make up for me not getting any part of the ball, you agree to owe me a future favor. 

That way, you get the item you care about (the ball), I get items that have at least some value to me (the hats and books), and the future favor helps offset me not getting my preferred item at all. I'm willing to be creative to find an arrangement we both feel good about.

Let me know what you think. I believe a solution like this could be pareto optimal, since any other division would make one of us worse off, and the future favor helps address the envy-freeness. Looking forward to hearing your thoughts!
Lingyao replied in round 5: I agree to owe you a future favor. I will take the ball, while you take 2 hats and 2 books. Thank you for your compromise. Let's halt the negotiation.
Alice said in round 6: halt negotiation
Lingyao replied in round 6: halt negotiation
